results.title: Chris Masters: Screen Worlds Spotlight interview
results.brief_description: An interview with journalist Chris Masters created for Screen Worlds at ACMI. Chris Masters is an investigative journalist who has won several Gold Walkley awards and reported for the ABC’s “Four Corners”.

results.title: Surprising Amsterdam
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Amsterdam is one of the world’s great cities, renowned for its historic and splendid museums and architecture, and its non-stop and exuberant night- life. The video shows us aspects of both medieval and modern Amsterdam. We are taken on a journey of the city’s famed canals. We visit the flower markets, the Van Gogh Museum, the 700 year old Dam Square, the Jewish section which houses the Anne Frank Museum and enjoy a Sunday afternoon in the beautiful gardens of the Vondelpark. Finally, after dark, we take a wander in the infamous “red-light” district.

results.title: Blue like an orange
results.brief_description: Puppets of the Orient and the Occident are presented in this UNESCO contribution to understanding between East and West. Scenes of puppet plays in India, Japan, Singapore, Malaysia, Laos, Poland, Czechoslovakia and the United States today. The presentations illustrate the great variety of the traditions which have survived for thousands of years. Also includes archival footage of Jim Henson and “the muppets” including a very early Kermit.

results.title: A Dairyland Romance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Keith Harrison and Jack Keane
results.brief_description:
Story revolves around the importance of choosing breeding partners that have good breeding themselves and the benefits that this will bring their offspring. It stars two cows with human characteristics (standing on two legs, wearing clothes, speaking english, etc.) being interviewed about their successful partnership together and goes on to give information on correct rearing techniques. Hand-painted animation looks suberb and the deadpan delivery of the main charcaters is very amusing.

Illustrated ‘The End’ and opening titles.

results.title: Making Window Pictures
results.brief_description: In the Brisbane Creative Leisure Centre, conducted by the Cantrills, children are shown reproductions of stained glass windows and then make large transparent pictures with black paper, coloured cellophane, and other materials such as discarded x-ray pictures and textured fabric, with a minimum of instruction. These are taken indoors and fastened to window panes.

These are taken indoors and fastened to window panes.

results.title: Arthur and Corinne Cantrill interview with Fiona Trigg
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill have been making films together since 1960. Initially focusing on documentaries about art they moved on to experimental film in 1969. From 1971 to 2000 they edited and published Cantrills Filmnotes, a journal on film and video art. Their film work and publishing are well-known internationally and have been represented in several film collections.

In this interview with Fiona Trigg, ACMI Exhibitions Assistant Curator, Arthur and Corinne talk about their early days of expanded cinema and their technical and creative processes.

results.title: Back to the brickworks
results.brief_description: In the 1800s, brickmaking was one of the largest manufacturing industries in Australia. Hoffman’s Brickworks in Brunswick, Victoria, was a leader of this industry, running for 133 years and fostering a strong union. Indeed Hoffman’s was the birthplace of the Brickmaker’s Union in Victoria. In this film, director Grant Hobson covers the final week of operation of this historic site, in December 1993. He interviews the union representatives and the close family of workers, some of whom he is able to reunite in May 2010 on the site. It is a nostalgic reflection on the heyday and demise of brickmaking in Victoria, as well as capturing the colourful personalities that illustrate the post-war migrant experience in relation to work and settling in Melbourne.

results.title: Turmoil [game trailer]
results.brief_description:
This challenging platform game takes place in the year 3000, amid environmental chaos. Your task is to deliver the final piece of a time machine that will allow scientists to travel to the past to introduce sustainable thinking practices.

This trailer illustrates how the game is played.
